My core passion lies in solving complex, 'mind-boggling' problems, which led me from programming in Python and Bash to the intricate world of digital defense.I am particularly fascinated by the intersection of cybersecurity and artificial intelligenceâ€”exploring how AI can be leveraged for proactive threat detection and automated incident response, as well as understanding the unique challenges of securing AI systems themselves. With a strong foundation in security principles, hands-on programming skills, and a relentless curiosity, I am seeking a remote internship where I can contribute to a forward-thinking team and apply my analytical abilities to the evolving challenges of the AI-driven security landscape.

projects.name: Fruity Cipher
projects.description: Engineered 'Fruity Cipher,' a custom 168-bit polymorphic block cipher. The algorithm implements a 'dynamic opcode' architecture where mathematical operations (Rotation, Permutation, XOR, and Modular Arithmetic) are randomized per block based on a generated 'Recipe.' It features a custom 24-bit integer processing pipeline, a global 'Banana' whitening phase for diffusion, and Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) for avalanche effects. The system is designed as a Hybrid Cryptosystem, using RSA to securely encapsulate the polymorphic execution path (the Recipe).

projects.name: Cowrie SSH Honeypot Experiment
projects.description: Deployed and monitored a high-interaction Cowrie honeypot on Microsoft Azure to capture and analyze real-world SSH brute force vectors. The experiment utilized Python and Plotly for data visualization, processing over 54,000 events in 48 hours to map global attack origins. Key analysis identified specific crypto-mining signatures (Outlaw group) and IoT botnet patterns, providing concrete evidence against security by obscurity.

projects.name: Lino(The AI Gatekeeper)
projects.description: Engineered 'Lino,' a proof-of-concept, next-generation security gateway designed to protect web applications and servers. The system intercepts incoming requests, leveraging the Gemini AI API to perform real-time content analysis and block potential threats based on scan results. Future development is focused on creating a custom-trained model using public cybersecurity data for more advanced, proactive threat detection.

projects.name: My retro Win95 style Website
projects.description: Designed and developed this fully interactive portfolio from scratch to create a unique and memorable user experience, styled after the Windows 95 operating system. The desktop environment is built with vanilla JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, featuring a multi-window interface, draggable and resizable windows, and dynamically loaded content from a central JSON file.
